repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
(Part of https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/30319)

## Problem:

Cannot detach the current UI.

## Solution:

- Introduce `:detach`.
- Introduce `Channel.detach`.

close #23441
close #23093

## TODO

- Windows support is opt-in via `__NVIM_DETACH=1`, but currently broken.

comment_data.body: @zeertzjq this expect() is the same as the one above. Is that intentional?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3554,26 +3643,7 @@ describe('TUI client', function()
     set_session(server_super)
     feed_data(status and ':' .. status .. 'cquit!\n' or ':quit!\n')
     status = status and status or 0
-    screen_server:expect {
-      grid = [[
-                                                        |
-      [Process exited ]] .. status .. [[]^ {MATCH:%s+}|
-                                                        |*4
-      {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
-    ]],
-    }
-    -- assert that client has exited
-    screen_client:expect {

comment_data.body:
@zeertzjq in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/c26b39a9aa56e834262753e08372240fde9dcdf1 you changed this expect() to be more strict. I relaxed it again because the cirrus freebsd tests fail:

```
FAILED  
test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua
 @ 
3666
: 
TUI client exits when server quits with :quit
test/functional/terminal/tui_spec.lua:3646: Row 1 did not match.
Expected:
  |*                                                  |
  |*[Process exited 0]^ {MATCH:%s+}|
  |*                                                  |
  |*                                                  |
  |*                                                  |
  |                                                  |
  |{3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
Actual:
  |*Hello, World                                      |
  |*[Process exited 0]{4:^                                }|
  |*{4:~                                                 }|
  |*{4:~                                                 }|
  |*{5:[No Name] [+]                                     }|
  |                                                  |
  |{3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
```

Doesn't seem like an essential behavior, although ideally it would be more consistent on all platforms.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3554,26 +3643,7 @@ describe('TUI client', function()
     set_session(server_super)
     feed_data(status and ':' .. status .. 'cquit!\n' or ':quit!\n')
     status = status and status or 0
-    screen_server:expect {
-      grid = [[
-                                                        |
-      [Process exited ]] .. status .. [[]^ {MATCH:%s+}|
-                                                        |*4
-      {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
-    ]],
-    }
-    -- assert that client has exited
-    screen_client:expect {
-      grid = [[
-                                                        |
-      [Process exited ]] .. status .. [[]^ {MATCH:%s+}|
-                                                        |*4
-      {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
-    ]],
-    }
-
-    server_super:close()
-    client_super:close()
+    screen_server:expect({any='Process exited ' .. status})

comment_data.body: Not good that we are skipping all these tests on Windows. But at least the new tests above should run there.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,6 +33,92 @@ local assert_log = t.assert_log
 
 local testlog = 'Xtest-tui-log'
 
+describe('TUI :detach', function()
+  before_each(function()
+    os.remove(testlog)
+  end)
+  after_each(function()
+    -- os.remove(testlog)
+  end)
+
+  it('does not stop server', function()
+    local server_super = n.clear()
+    local client_super = n.new_session(true)
+    finally(function()
+      server_super:close()
+      client_super:close()
+    end)
+
+    local child_server = new_pipename()
+    local screen = tt.setup_child_nvim({
+      '--listen',
+      child_server,
+      '-u',
+      'NONE',
+      '-i',
+      'NONE',
+      '--cmd',
+      'colorscheme vim',
+      '--cmd',
+      nvim_set .. ' notermguicolors laststatus=2 background=dark',
+    }, {
+      env = {
+        NVIM_LOG_FILE = testlog,
+      },
+    })
+
+    tt.feed_data('iHello, World')
+    screen:expect {
+      grid = [[
+      Hello, World^                                      |
+      {4:~                                                 }|*3
+      {MATCH:No Name}
+      {3:-- INSERT --}                                      |
+      {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
+    ]],
+    }
+
+    local child_session = n.connect(child_server)
+    local status, child_uis = child_session:request('nvim_list_uis')
+    assert(status)
+    eq(1, #child_uis)
+
+    tt.feed_data('\027\027:detach\013')
+    -- Note: "Process exited" message is misleading; tt.setup_child_nvim() sees the foreground
+    -- process (client) exited, and doesn't know the server is still running?
+    screen:expect {
+      any = [[Hello, World.*Process exited]],
+    }
+
+    child_uis --[[@type any[] ]] = ({ child_session:request('nvim_list_uis') })[2]
+    eq(0, #child_uis)
+
+    -- NOTE: The tt.setup_child_nvim() screen just wraps :terminal, it's not connected to the child.
+    -- To use it again, we need to detach the old one.
+    screen:detach()
+
+    -- Edit some text on the headless server.
+    status = (child_session:request('nvim_input', 'ddiWe did it, pooky.<Esc><Esc>'))
+    assert(status)
+
+    -- Test reattach by connecting a new TUI.
+    local screen_reattached = tt.setup_child_nvim({
+      '--remote-ui',
+      '--server',
+      child_server,
+    })
+    screen_reattached:expect {
+      grid = [[
+      We did it, pooky^.                                 |
+      {4:~                                                 }|*3
+      {5:[No Name] [+]                                     }|
+                                                        |
+      {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
+    ]],
+    }
+  end)
+end)
+
 if t.skip(is_os('win')) then
   return

comment_data.body: It's not the same. The session is different.

     ]])
 
     feed(':q<CR>')
-    screen:expect([[
-                                                        |
-      [Process exited 0]^                                |

-    ]])
+    if is_os('freebsd') then
+      screen:expect { any = '[Process exited 0]' }

comment_regular_data.body:
Can someone with Windows try this out?

1. Define environment variable `__NVIM_DETACH=1` *before* starting `nvim`
2. run `nvim`
3. does it work normally?
4. try the `:detach` command

title: feat(ui): UI :detach command
